identificationModule.officialTitle: Central Executive Training for ADHD: Efficacy Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The goal of the current project is to assess the efficacy of Central Executive Training (CET) for youth with ADHD. CET is a new, computerized training intervention that targets specific components of the working memory system. Two versions of CET were developed as part of our R34, each targeting a different combinations of executive functions. The final CET protocol reflects the contributions and feedback of a diverse group of caregivers, children with ADHD, and recognized experts in human cognition, ADHD treatment research, randomized control trial (RCT) intervention design methods, serious game theory and task design, cognitive training, and the role of executive dysfunction in ADHD.

armGroups.label: CET-Working Memory (WM)
interventionNames: Behavioral: Central Executive Training: Working Memory

armGroups.label: CET-Behavioral Inhibition (BI)
interventionNames: Behavioral: Central Executive Training: Inhibitory Control

primaryOutcomes.description: Average of T-scores on parent-report ADHD symptoms questionnaires (Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale (ADHD-5) Inattention and Hyperactivity subscales, Behavioral Assessment System for Children (BASC-3) Inattention and Hyperactivity subscales)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Average of stimuli correct per trial on the Rapport phonological and visuospatial working memory tests
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Average of performance on the stop-signal (stop-signal delay metric) and go/no-go tests (commission errors)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Actigraph-measured hyperactivity during working memory testing
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportional integrating measure (PIM) units from autographs worn on non dominant wrist, left ankle, and right ankle during Rapport working memory tests. PIM units from each actigraph will be aggregated by summing them to create a Total Hyperactivity Score.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportional integrating measure (PIM) units from autographs worn on non dominant wrist, left ankle, and right ankle. During beginning and end of session baseline painting tasks (described in Rapport et al., 2009). PIM units from each actigraph will be aggregated by summing them to create a Total Hyperactivity Score.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

otherOutcomes.description: Standard scores on NIH List Sorting test
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Follow-up testing: 2-4 months after the post-treatment evaluation (variable time frame to account for school breaks)

otherOutcomes.description: Average of T-scores on teacher-report ADHD symptoms questionnaires (ADHD-5 Inattention and Hyperactivity subscales, BASC-3 Inattention and Hyperactivity subscales)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

otherOutcomes.description: Total score (T-score) for academic performance (teacher ratings)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

otherOutcomes.measure: Children's Organizational Skills Scale (COSS) Parent Report
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

otherOutcomes.measure: Children's Organizational Skills Scale (COSS) Teacher Report
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

otherOutcomes.description: Parent-reported total score (standard score) on Social Skills Improvement System (SSIS)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

otherOutcomes.description: Teacher-reported total score (standard score) on Social Skills Improvement System (SSIS)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

otherOutcomes.description: Parent-reported total score (T-score) on Parent Relationship Questionnaire (PRQ)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Immediate post-treatment (within 2 weeks of final treatment session)

otherOutcomes.measure: Kaufman Test of Educational Achievement Third Edition (KTEA-3) Reading Comprehension
otherOutcomes.description: Standard score on KTEA-3 Reading Comprehension subtest
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Follow-up testing: 2-4 months after the post-treatment evaluation (variable time frame to account for school breaks)

otherOutcomes.measure: Kaufman Test of Educational Achievement Third Edition (KTEA-3) Listening Comprehension
otherOutcomes.description: Standard score on KTEA-3 Listening Comprehension subtest
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Follow-up testing: 2-4 months after the post-treatment evaluation (variable time frame to account for school breaks)

otherOutcomes.measure: Kaufman Test of Educational Achievement Third Edition (KTEA-3) Reading Fluency
otherOutcomes.description: Standard score on KTEA-3 Reading Fluency subtest
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Follow-up testing: 2-4 months after the post-treatment evaluation (variable time frame to account for school breaks)

otherOutcomes.measure: Kaufman Test of Educational Achievement Third Edition (KTEA-3) Math Fluency
otherOutcomes.description: Standard score on KTEA-3 Math Fluency subtest
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Follow-up testing: 2-4 months after the post-treatment evaluation (variable time frame to account for school breaks)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Children ages 8-12 with principal ADHD diagnoses (via Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders semi-structured clinical interviewing (K-SADS)
* Parent AND teacher ratings in clinical/borderline range based on age and gender on ADHD-RS-5 or BASC-3 Attention Problems/Hyperactivity subscales
* Below average or lower working memory on at least one pre-treatment WM test. All ADHD presentations will be eligible.

Exclusion Criteria:

* gross neurological, sensory, or motor impairment
* history of seizure disorder, psychosis, bipolar, or severe dysregulation disorders that may interfere with study participation (substance use, disruptive mood dysregulation, intermittent explosive, reactive attachment)
* intellectual disability or Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children (WISC-V) short-form intelligence quotient (FSIQ) \< 78 (1.5 standard deviations (SD) below mean)
* conditions requiring acute intervention, e.g., active suicidality
* non-English speaking child or parent.
